title: Rump steak with blue cheese butter
description: Rump steak is hard to beat; it's affordable and full of flavour. Take the steaks out of the fridge 30 minutes before cooking.
instructions: In a small bowl, mash together the blue cheese and butter until completely combined; the finished result should be a soft blue colour and deliciously salty. Use cling film to roll the butter into a sausage, then chill until needed.
Heat 1/2 tbsp oil in a frying pan over a high heat. Season the steaks and cook for 2 minutes on each side for medium-rare. Cover loosely with foil and set aside to rest.

Add the remaining 1/2 tbsp oil to the pan and, when hot, add the garlic and cabbage; cook, tossing regularly, for 4-5 minutes. Stir in the thyme leaves. Serve each steak topped with 1/2 the blue cheese butter, and the cabbage on the side.
imageDesc: A wooden chopping board with a gloriously pink steak served on it, blue cheese butter melted over the top, and a bowl filled with crisp savoy cabbage to the side
